oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1943-11-13 - WSM
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: First recording is an excerpt of a Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 13, 1943. Featuring Louis Buck (announcer), Bashful Brother Oswald (performer), The Duke of Paducah (performer), Rachel Veach (performer) [unconfirmed], and Minnie Pearl (performer) on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.) Second recording is an excerpt of a Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from June 6, 1953. Featuring Rex Allen (host, performer), the Old Hickory Singers (performer), Kitty Wells (performer), Neal Burris (performer), Tommy Jackson (performer), Lew Childre (performer) and Stringbean (performer) on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.) Third recording is an excerpt of a Royal Cola sponsored Grand Old Opry segment featuring Roy Acuff (host), Louis Buck (announcer), and Bashful Brother Oswald (performer) on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bashful Brother Oswald; Rachel Veach; The Duke of Paducah; Minnie Pearl; Rex Allen; Rod Brasfield; Kitty Wells; Stringbean; Old Hickory Singers; Neal Burris; Tommy Jackson; Lew Childre
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- Corrine, Corrina (Bashful Brother Oswald and Rachel Veach) -- Louis Buck introduces The Duke of Paducah -- Comedy routine (The Duke of Paducah) (incomplete) -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) (incomplete) -- She'll Be Coming 'Round The Mountain (Minnie Pearl) -- Whitey Ford and Louis Buck talk about Prince Albert tobacco (incomplete) -- Old Grey Bonnet (Old Hickory Singers) -- Rex Allen introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Rex Allen) -- Rex Allen introduces Kitty Wells -- You Said You Could Do Without Me (Kitty Wells) -- Rex Allen introduces Stringbean -- Take Me Back To Tulsa (Stringbean) -- Rex Allen talks -- No One Will Ever Know (Rex Allen) (incomplete) -- patriotic songs (whistle w/ piano) -- Medley - I Want A Girl (Just Like The Girl That Married Dear Old Dad)/Wait 'Till The Sun Shines, Nellie (Old Hickory Singers) -- Don't Give Me Kisses (Neal Burris) -- Kitty Wells talks about her career briefly -- Honky Tonk Waltz (Kitty Wells) -- Rex Allen talks about Prince Albert and introduces Tommy Jackson and Lew Childre -- Fisher's Hornpipe (Lew Childre and Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- When I Take My Vacation In Heaven (Rex Allen) -- John Hardy (Bashful Brother Oswald) -- Louis Buck and Roy Acuff talk about students from Paris at the Opry -- Closing statement (Roy Acuff) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Louis Buck)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Veach, Rachel; Bashful Brother Oswald; Duke of Paducah, 1901-1986; Minnie Pearl; Cannon, Sarah Ophelia, 1912-1996; Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Old Hickory Singers; Brasfield, Rod, 1910-1958; Allen, Rex, 1920-1999; Wells, Kitty; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Burris, Neal; Jackson, Tommy; Childre, Lew, 1901-1961; Acuff, Roy, 1903-1992;
